title: Charlie Daniels Band - Fire on the mountain - 1974
description:
Southern rock at it&#039;s best!

Charlie Daniels recorded his first solo album, Charlie Daniels, in 1971.
His first hit, the novelty song "Uneasy Rider", was from his 1973 second album, Honey in the Rock, and reached #9 on the Billboard Hot 100.

In 1974, Daniels organized the first in a series of Volunteer Jam concerts based in or around Nashville, Tennessee. Except for a three-year gap in the late 1980s, these jams have continued ever since.

In 1975, he had a top 30 hit as leader of the Charlie Daniels Band with the Southern Rock self-identification anthem "The South&#039;s Gonna Do It Again". "Long Haired Country Boy" was also a minor hit in that year. Both song are included in this CD.

Enjoy, please comment - and seed.
